text: Lynda Tolbert-Goode (born October 3, 1967 in Washington, D.C.) is a retired American hurdler and sprinter. She claimed the bronze medal in the women's 100 m hurdles event at the 1993 World Championships in Stuttgart, Germany. ==Achievements== All results regarding 100m hurdles. {| |- | 1989 | World Cup | Barcelona, Spain | bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd | 12.86 |- | 1992 | Olympic Games | Barcelona, Spain | 4th | 12.75 |- | 1993 | World Championships | Stuttgart, Germany | bgcolor="cc9966" | 3rd | 12.67 |- | 1996 | Olympic Games | Atlanta, united States | 7th | 13.11 |} ==External links== * Lynda Tolbert-Goode at USATF * * * Category:1967 births Category:Living people Category:American female sprinters Category:American female hurdlers Category:African-American female track and field athletes Category:Sportspeople from Washington, D.C. title: Lynda Tolbert-Goode
